definitions.definition: used to describe something that has no water or other liquid in, on, or around it:
examples: I hung his wet trousers on the radiator, but they're not dry yet.

definitions.definition: If a river or other area of water runs dry, the water gradually disappears from it:
examples: By this time all the wells had run dry.

definitions.definition: Dry hair or skin does not have enough of the natural oils that make it soft and smooth:
Dry bread is plain, without butter, jam, etc.:
examples: All I was offered was a piece of dry bread and an apple!

definitions.definition: to become dry, or to make something become dry:
examples: Will this paint dry by tomorrow?

definitions.definition: to dry plates, knives, forks, etc. after they have been washed
